result.execSummary:
The defendant Kylaa V Carter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Attend school daily and obtain HSED. Obtain and maintain  employment. Granted Huber for work and school.

No contact with the victim J.V. (person, property, residence or family). Pay ZCI fees. Must reside with her mother and follow all the rules at home. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.
Court costs are waived. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Attend school daily and obtain HSED. Obtain and maintain  employment. Granted Huber for work and school.

No contact with the victim J.V. (person, property, residence or family). Pay ZCI fees. Must reside with her mother and follow all the rules at home. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kylaa V Carter in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  Dirk Christian Jensen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Plea to count 1 as amended to Battery & count 2. 
Rights Given
P- Guilty
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 1 as amended & count 2.

Ct 1- 30 days RCJ - stayed, 2 years probation

Ct 2- 30 days RCJ - stayed, 2 years probation 

Conditions:
Complete High School and obtain employment
Huber for work and school, credit for time served
No contact with J.V.
Attend school daily
30 hours of community service
Pay ZCI fees
Must reside with mother and follow her rules at home
Eligible for expungement if successfully completes probation
Provide DNA Sample + pay surcharge
Waive court costs

Defendant Kylaa V Carter in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore. W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Request a plea / sentencing hearing. 
BTC: Adj  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 10:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:***MODIFIED 8/26/15 TO INCLUDE:  NO CONTACT W/WITNESSES AND ANYONE ELSE LISTED IN THE COMPLAINT, ATTEND SCHOOLD EVERYDAY IT IS IN SESSION, NO CONTACT W/NORTH BEACH IN RACINE WI, ALL RULES SET BY MOTHER ARE TO BE OBEYED,   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to school, court and meeting w/her Atty*** No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). JV.   No contact with the co-defendant. CC  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 12/03/2015 REMOVE GPS MONITORING**

Defendant Kylaa V Carter in court with attorney Erika Lynn Moore.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- Will be modifing the offer due to the violations of bond. Request the court increase the bond and request a staus date.
Def- Request the court impose a small amount of cash.
BTC: **DEFENDANT TAKEN INTO CUSTODY **Bond modified to remove GPS monitoring and must post an additional $500 cash.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for December 11, 2015 at 09:00 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Kylaa V Carter
Current: 1818 Racine Street, Racine, WI 53403 United States  (Effective: 11-06-2015)
Prior: 1824 Villa St, Racine, WI 53403
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 3, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:15 am.

(ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to school, court and meeting w/her Atty*** No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). JV.   No contact with the co-defendant. CC  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kylaa V Carter in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Defendant Kylaa V Carter in custody.  Randall Schneider appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter Mark Garvin.  Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over.
Defense requests bond modification. 
State objects to modification. 
BTC: Bond modification is granted. Bond is modified to a $200 cash bond and $1000.00 co-signature bond w/Mother . Same conditions apply but to include: No contact w/witness and anyone else listed in the complaint. Attend school everyday in session,   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting w/her Atty and going to school. No contact w/North Beach. All rules set by Defendant's Mother must be obeyed.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:   No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family). JV.   No contact with the co-defendant. CC  Make all court appearances on time.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Kylaa V Carter in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Kylaa V Carter in custody.  Jennifer C. Tanck-Adams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 09:00 am.
